description.narrative: The development objective of the proposed project is to enhance the demand for good governance (DFGG) in priority reform areas by strengthening institutions, supporting partnerships, and sharing lessons.

participating-org.narrative: National Committee for Management of Decentralization and Deconcentration Reform Secretariat (NCDD)

condition.narrative: A PCG, PMT, and PCO, with adequately qualified membership, shall meet on a regular basis and carry out its functions, inaccordancewith the approved PIM, throughout project implementation
For sustainability of ACF and AC, Recipient shall make best efforts to ensure financial contributions from partners for 2.5% in2009, 5% in 2010, 10% in 2011, and 15% in 2012.
Recipient, shall adopt a PIM and carry out the project in accordance with the provisions of the manual including the GoodGovernance Framework.
Recipient, through MOI, shall ensure that by Dec 31, 2009, baselines and other relevant M&E systems, acceptable to theAssociation,are established for each RIA and PIE
Recipient, through NCDDS, to ensure recurrent costs for the operations of the OWSOs are transferred to Recipient at the rate of50%in Year 3 and 100% in Year 4
Recipient, through the MOI, shall ensure that by March 30 of each year, starting 2009, the RIAs and the PIEs prepare annualprogress reports
Recipient, through the MOI, shall ensure that by September 30 of each year, starting 2009, the RIAs and PIEs prepare, annual workplans for the next calendar year
Recipient, under Part C of the Project, cause the MOI, to organize a learning program for state institutions and NSAs

title.narrative: IO1.3: Number of line agencies/service delivery functions assigned to OWSOs.

comment.narrative: ADD
Target - 10 line ministries delegating 125 functions.Target met.
Target met.10 line ministries delegating 193 functions.

title.narrative: IO1.1: % of Arbitration Council awards considered to be of satisfactory quality or better.

comment.narrative: Audit conducted of 2009 awards.
Target met. measured through independent quality audit of awards, against 2009 baseline.
Target met.

title.narrative: 4.3: % of OWSO clients who report paying unofficial fees.

comment.narrative: Baseline % of clients reporting paying unofficial fees based on payments made to Line Ministries prior to establishment of OWSOapproach.
OWSO offices have an ombudsman available full time near the OWSO office. Data on the number and type of complaints is documentedeach mission in the AM annex.
Will report on survey data. Out of 27 complaints in 2013.

title.narrative: Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits addressed (%)

comment.narrative: Baseline (mid 2010)72 complaints out of 83,000 trasnactions
This indicator is distorted. All grievances registered concern the OWSO transactions for administrative services. In this periodthere were over 27 complaints for 150,000 transactions.

title.narrative: 2.4: % of DO clients who report a high confidence in the independence, credibility and effectiveness of the district complaints handling system.

comment.narrative: Baseline 201174% Independence86% Credibility83% Effectiveness
Target = baseline + 10%[Independence = 84% Credibility = 93%Effectiveness = 96%]
Target met.2014 NGO Survey100% independence70% credibility78% effectiveness

title.narrative: IO2.3: % of NSAC sub-grantees whose sub-projects reflect good practice in social accountability design and implementation.

comment.narrative: New indicator.
Endline evaluation.Refined target:design = 90%of which, 70% implemented effectively.
72.73% design79.17% implementationRound 2 average is 84.26Values at Feb 2013 - sample will increase by 2 projects in finaldocumentation. IA check methodology is consistent with target.

title.narrative: IO2.2: % of citizens reporting that engagement in decision making processes of communes / local service delivery agents (clinics, schools, communes / districts) has been enhanced through subprojects.

comment.narrative: New indicator.
Target met.

title.narrative: IO3.1: MOI, through PCO, plans and establishes a resource centre for good governance and provides learning services in collaboration with technical support from TAF/ACF/OWSO.

comment.narrative: New indicator.

target.value: Resource center established and providing learning services in collaboration.

comment.narrative: Target met. Governance resource and learning center now opened and functioning. Learning events geared toward SAF

title.narrative: 4.3 (a): % of AC clients who report paying unofficial fees.

comment.narrative: No baseline information available.
No reports of unofficial payments to date.

title.narrative: IO1.4: Reduced cost and time taken for processing OWSO transactions (cf. line agency service standards).

comment.narrative: No data currently available.
Target = 50% < baseline
43% less cost; 0% less time. further information pending.

title.narrative: IO2.1: Increase in social accountability related knowledge, skills, and capacity to implement in participating NSAs.

comment.narrative: Revised indicator. self assessment of SAc skills no longer measured.
Pending end evaluation.
Pending evaluation of final ISAF trainings held in conjunction with PCO.

title.narrative: IO3.6: Positive evaluation of the contribution of partnerships to the project development objective.

comment.narrative: Revised indicator.
Endline evaluations by TAF and PCO. It has been agreed that the Partnership indicator will not be quantified due to thedistortions created by counting partnerships in the first half of the project]
Partnerships study complete will be written up in end evaluation.

title.narrative: IO3.2: Local social accountability community of practice including a cadre of trainers, networks, who are able to undertake ongoing training and capacity-building in the area of SAc.

comment.narrative: Revised indicator.

target.value: actual value and description of capacity

comment.narrative: Endline TAF and PCO evaluations
Pending evaluation of ISAF capacity building planned up to end September. 2 NGOs support each learning theme in GRLC. Update oncadre of trainers expected in end evaluation.

title.narrative: 3.2: % of clients/local elected officials satisfied with quality of services provided at OWSOs across targeted districts.

comment.narrative: clients 93%elected officials 97%
Target = baseline + 5%This end target was too high.These end results are satisfactory.
Satisfactory result; as baseline was high at 93%, target was set too high.90.33 Clients98.00 Officialsfrom NGO surveys

title.narrative: 1.3 % of citizens (in target areas) aware of and understanding non-state actors facilitation of social accountability

comment.narrative: new indicator
Endline evaluation TAF.Refined targets: Awareness:Village level =70%Commune level = 50%Understanding:70% ofawarenessImpact on governance70% of understanding
Target met.78.62% awareness78.95% understanding75.0% positive resultsCompiled at the commune level only.

title.narrative: IO1.6: Steps taken to integrate district complaints mechanism (DO) in IP3 sub-national accountability system.

comment.narrative: new indicator.

target.value: Agreed sub-national CHM in place by project end.

comment.narrative: Off track -- no information provided.
Off track -- no information provided.

title.narrative: 3.3 Project activities trigger changes in policy or practice that enhance transparency, accountability and civil society partnerships in participating SIs

comment.narrative: revised
Qualitative mid and end evaluation by TAF and PCO needed to finalize qualitative indicators. to be complete Jan 2014.

actual.value: Write ups being prepared for each IA.

comment.narrative: The SAF was signed as policy in July 2013.10 line ministries issued decisions to delegate functions to OWSO. OWSO isinstitutionalized in MOI, both at district and national level. Partnerships developed with civil society groups in 9districts.The GLRC is institutionalized in MOI and provides governance training/ workshops.Nonstate actors indicate significantimprovement citing instances of improved responsiveness, transparency and inclusion of citizens in formal processes.

title.narrative: IO1.2: Revenue generated through tri-partite contributions by AC as % of operating costs

comment.narrative: Target met.

title.narrative: 2.3: Number of local disputes or complaints received and mediated by DOs (citizens offices) across all target districts,

comment.narrative: Target = actual value.This indicator provides information on the use of the DO as a complaints handling system. This indicator isproblematic because it is not possible to attribute an increase in complaints to be an increase in problems. It can be either anincrease in problems or an increase in the confidence in the complaints handling system. Hence only actual values are tracked.
840 cumulative total, see Annex 4 for detailed breakdown of OWSO complaints for project.

title.narrative: 4.2: % of SIs monitored under the project for which monitoring is determined to have a positive impact on SI performance.

comment.narrative: Awaits final confirmation by end March.

Target met.By agencies:commune level = 226district = 33health clinic = 153schools = 330OWSO = 9

title.narrative: IO3.5: Increased trust and constructive engagement between NSAs and government agencies.

comment.narrative: Endline evaluations by TAF and PCO

Pending end evaluation. Qualitative data from TAFdocumented.OWSO efforts to work with NGOs on exit surveys are promising. Inoverall terms the endorsement of a social accountability framework is a significant step forward.

title.narrative: Grievances related to delivery of project benefits that are addressed-(number)
IO3.3: Lessons (cases, reports, studies) and experiences from within the project are documented, and used in training and capacity building programs

comment.narrative: Target: 3-4 lessons will be developed each quarter until the end of the project

actual.value: Target met. The project has produced a series of lessons and these have been used to bring about policy change and have been fedinto capacity building, especially for the ISAF. A learning note series documents key lessons from each IA.

comment.narrative: 2 learning notes on partnerships and 4 new notes from OWSO are available. All IAs have documented lessons in QPRs.

title.narrative: IO3.4: % of participants in Learning (3B) events given rating as meeting participant needs

comment.narrative: Pending further results.

title.narrative: 1.2: % of citizens aware of and understanding services provided by OWSO, and DO (once established) in targeted districts.

comment.narrative: Target = baseline + 10%Midline can be used as baseline in new districts.Refined target account for the time taken to buildcitizen awareness after a new OWSO is established. % awareness after year establishedyear 1 = 30%year 2 = 50%year 3 = 60%
Target met in most districts (one outlier at 57%) see detailed results.Averages of 4 NGO surveys76.8% awareness OWSO55.80%understand OWSO57.80% awareness DO49.33% understand DO
